benchmark_details.name: SwallowCode and SwallowMath
benchmark_details.overview: SwallowCode and SwallowMath are openly licensed datasets designed to enhance large language model (LLM) capabilities in program synthesis and mathematical reasoning. SwallowCode refines Python code from The-Stack-v2 through a four-stage pipeline, while SwallowMath transforms the Finemath-4+ dataset, improving quality and performance.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To significantly enhance LLM performance in code generation and mathematical reasoning through refined pre-training datasets.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The rewriting process may preserve biases from source data.

data.source: The datasets are constructed by rewriting public datasets, including The-Stack-v2 and Finemath-4+, enhancing quality through systematic filtering and rewriting processes.
data.size: 16.1 billion tokens for SwallowCode, 2.3 billion tokens for SwallowMath
data.annotation: Data was enriched without traditional filtering, focusing on transformation and utility maximization.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated by evaluating model performance on benchmarks like HumanEval and GSM8K.
methodology.interpretation: Higher metrics indicate better LLM performance in generating code snippets and mathematical solutions.
methodology.baseline_results: Continuous pre-training with benchmarks led to significant improvements, with +17.0 on HumanEval for SwallowCode.
methodology.validation: Model performance was validated against multiple benchmarks.
